page.title: 02WESTROP PLAYGROUP,HIGHWORTH
page.content: The Playgroup was founded by a group of Mums in 1973. The grounds,roughly an acre,are rented from the council, and the building is owned by the Playgroup Committee. Only thirty children are allowed in the playgroup at any one time.They go either in the morning or in the afternoon. There are three paid workers and four voluntary workers every session. The age of the children varies from three to five years old. The children don't have their lunch there,only a glass of milk in the morning or afternoon. They have a few small trips,and,once a year,a bigger trip. The Playgroup runs on the children. It costs 80p for a morning and 70p for an afternoon. They also have other events to raise money such as sales,fetes and sponsored trike rides.
